â
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}}, {{lse|GGEA}}) is an American public [[corporation]], specializing in [[Google search|Internet search]], that hosts a number of [[Internet]]-based services and products. The company generates profits primarily from [[advertising]] through its [[AdWords]] program, which is diplayed on its free of cost [[Gmail]] [[e-mail]] service, [[Google Maps|online mapping]] service, [[Google Apps]] office productivity program, [[YouTube]] [[video-sharing]] website, and [[List of Google products|more]].<ref name="financialtables">{{cite web |url=http://investor.google.com/fin_data.html |title=Financial Tables |publisher=Google Investor Relations |accessdate=2008-01-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Online Ads Give Google Huge Gain in Profit |author=David A. Vise |url=David A. Vise |newspaper=The Washington Post |date=2005-10-21 |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> Google has also developed an [[open source]] [[web browser]] named [[Google Chrome]], and the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[mobile phone]] [[operating system]], used on a number of [[HTC]] phones such as the [[Nexus One]]. Its headquarters, often referred to as the [[Googleplex]] derived from the number [[googolplex]], is located in [[Mountain View, California]]. {{As of|2009|03|31|df=US}}, the company had 19,786 full-time employees. It runs thousands of servers across the world, processing millions of search requests each day and about one [[petabyte]] of user-generated data each hour.<ref name="googlopoly">"[http://www.wired.com/techbiz/it/magazine/17-08/mf_googlopoly?currentPage=all Why Is Obama's Top Antitrust Cop Gunning for Google?]". ''[[Wired Magazine]]''. 20. July, 2009. Retrieved on July 21, 2009.</ref> Even the company's name, Google, was a play on the large number [[googol]] to represent the large amount of information the company set out to organize. <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/corporate/history.html |title=Google Milestones |publisher=Google Inc. |accessdate=14 February 2010}}</ref>
+
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}}, {{lse|GGEA}}) is an American public [[corporation]], specializing in [[Google search|Internet search]], that hosts a number of [[Internet]]-based services and products. Google was founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while attending [[Stanford University]]. It was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 4]], [[1998]], with its [[initial public offering]] to follow on [[August 19]], [[2004]]. Its headquarters, located in [[Mountain View, California]], is often referred to as the [[Googleplex]], which is derived from the number [[googolplex]]. {{As of|2009|03|31|df=US}}, the company had 19,786 full-time employees. It runs thousands of servers across the world, processing millions of search requests each day and about one [[petabyte]] of user-generated data each hour.<ref name="googlopoly">"[http://www.wired.com/techbiz/it/magazine/17-08/mf_googlopoly?currentPage=all Why Is Obama's Top Antitrust Cop Gunning for Google?]". ''[[Wired Magazine]]''. 20. July, 2009. Retrieved on July 21, 2009.</ref> Even the company's name, Google, was a play on the large number [[googol]] to represent the large amount of information the company set out to organize. <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/corporate/history.html |title=Google Milestones |publisher=Google Inc. |accessdate=14 February 2010}}</ref>
â
Google was founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while students at [[Stanford University]]. It was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on September 4, 1998. The [[initial public offering]] was on August 19, 2004. It raised [[United States dollar|$]]1.67 billion, implying a total value of $23 billion. Google's rapid growth has sparked a sequence of new products, [[List of Google acquisitions|acquisitions]] and [[Google#Partnerships|partnerships]] beyond its core [[search engine]]. [[Google#Environmentalism|Environmentalism]], [[Google.org|philanthropy]] and [[Google#Corporate affairs and culture|positive employee relations]] were from the start assigned an important role in establishing [[brand image]]. Google has been repeatedly named [[Fortune Magazine]]'s ''Number One Best Place to Work''<ref name="best_company">"[http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/bestcompanies/2007/full_list/ 100 Best Companies to Work For 2007]". ''[[Fortune Magazine]] (link published by [[CNN]])''. 22 January 2007. Retrieved on January 8, 2007.</ref> and ''most powerful brand in the world''.<ref>[http://www.millwardbrown.com/Sites/optimor/Media/Pdfs/en/BrandZ/BrandZ-2008-Report.pdf BrandZ Top 100 2008 Report] (PDF)</ref> [[Alexa Internet|Alexa]] lists Google as the Internet's most visited website.<ref>{{cite web | title = Alexa Traffic Rank for Google (three month average)|author=| publisher = [[Alexa Internet]]| url =http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/google.com|accessdate= 2009-09-06}}</ref>
+
Google's rapid growth has sparked a sequence of new products, [[List of Google acquisitions|acquisitions]] and [[Google#Partnerships|partnerships]] beyond its core [[search engine]]. The company offers online [[productivity]] [[software]], including its [[Gmail]] [[e-mail]] software, [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Reader]] [[news aggregator]], and [[Google Docs]] word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation program. Google has also entered the [[social networking]] market with [[Orkut]], [[Google Profiles]], and Google Buzz. Furthermore, the company's products have been extended to the [[Desktop environment|desktop]] with applications such as Google's web browser [[Google Chrome]], [[Picasa]] photo organization and editing software, [[Google Talk]] [[instant messaging]] application, and [[Google Earth]] virtual globe simulator. More notably, Google created the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[mobile phone]] [[operating system]], used on a number of [[HTC]] phones such as the [[Nexus One]] and [[Droid Eris]]. The company generates profits primarily from [[advertising]] through its [[AdWords]] program, which is diplayed on a number of its services, including the [[YouTube]] [[video sharing]] website it acquiesced in [[November]] 2006.<ref name="financialtables">{{cite web |url=http://investor.google.com/fin_data.html |title=Financial Tables |publisher=Google Investor Relations |accessdate=2008-01-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Online Ads Give Google Huge Gain in Profit |author=David A. Vise |url=David A. Vise |newspaper=The Washington Post |date=2005-10-21 |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref>
â
The company's [[mission statement|stated mission]] from the outset was "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>[http://www.google.com/corporate/ Google Corporate Information]</ref> Its unofficial slogan, coined by [[Gmail]]'s first engineer, [[Paul Buchheit]], was ''[[Don't be evil]]''.<ref>[http://blogoscoped.com/archive/2007-07-16-n55.html Paul Buchheit on Gmail, AdSense and More] Google Blogoscoped</ref><ref>[http://googlesystem.blogspot.com/2008/03/dont-be-evil-trigger-for-ethical.html Don't Be Evil, a Trigger for Ethical Questions] Google Operating System Blog</ref><ref>[http://www.crazyengineers.com/small-talk/1-cover-story/78-small-talk-with-mr-paul-buchheit-creator-of-gmail-adsense-a-friendfeed Small Talk with Mr. Paul Buchheit - Creator of Gmail, Adsense & FriendFeed!] CrazyEngineers</ref> Google has been [[Criticism of Google|criticized]] over issues of [[privacy]] of personal information, [[copyright]] and [[censorship by Google|censorship]].
+
The company's [[mission statement|stated mission]] from the outset was "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/corporate/ |title=Google Corporate Information |publisher=Google, Inc. |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> Its unofficial slogan, coined by [[Gmail]]'s first engineer, [[Paul Buchheit]], was ''[[Don't be evil]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://investor.google.com/conduct.html |title=Google Code of Conduct |date=2009-04-08 |publisher=Google, Inc. |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://blogoscoped.com/archive/2007-07-16-n55.html |title=Paul Buchheit on Gmail, AdSense and More |first=Philip|last=Lenssen |date=2007-07-16 |publisher=Google Blogscoped |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> Furthermore, Google has been repeatedly named [[Fortune Magazine]]'s ''Number One Best Place to Work''<ref name="best_company">"[http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/bestcompanies/2007/full_list/ 100 Best Companies to Work For 2007]". ''[[Fortune Magazine]] (link published by [[CNN]])''. 22 January 2007. Retrieved on January 8, 2007.</ref> and ''most powerful brand in the world''.<ref>[http://www.millwardbrown.com/Sites/optimor/Media/Pdfs/en/BrandZ/BrandZ-2008-Report.pdf BrandZ Top 100 2008 Report] (PDF)</ref> [[Alexa Internet|Alexa]] lists Google as the Internet's most visited website.<ref>{{cite web | title = Alexa Traffic Rank for Google (three month average)|author=| publisher = [[Alexa Internet]]| url =http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/google.com|accessdate= 2009-09-06}}</ref> Google has been [[Criticism of Google|criticized]] over issues of [[privacy]] of personal information, [[copyright]] and [[censorship by Google|censorship]].
